description: Prime degrees of absolutely reducible trinomials: primes p such that x^p + x^k + 1 is reducible over GF(2) for all k, p>k>0.
mathematica: Do[ k = 1; While[ ToString[ Factor[ x^Prime[ n ] + x^k + 1, Modulus -> 2 ] ] != ToString[ x^Prime[ n ] + x^k + 1 ] && k < Prime[ n ], k++ ]; If[ k == Prime[ n ], Print[ Prime[ n ] ] ], {n, 1, 144} ]
prog: (PARI) lista(nn) = {forprime(p=2, nn, ok = 1; for (k=1, p-1, if (polisirreducible(Mod(1,2)*(x^p + x^k + 1)), ok = 0; break);); if (ok, print1(p, ", ")););}
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Oct 30 2000
